Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is black in section, with remains of twelve lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, smudged in places, and containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.138)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87651) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87651)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 168 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
